causes: Engine coolant temperature out of range
Alternator failure or low charging voltage
remedies: Add coolant and pressure-test for leaks
Replace O2 sensors (front and rear as needed)
Diagnose and repair PCM driver fault
Repair intercooler or charge pipe leaks
Repair or replace restricted exhaust components
Perform compression test and repair cylinder leakage

P0001.title: Fuel Volume Regulator Control Circuit/Open
P0001.description: The PCM has detected an open circuit in the fuel volume regulator control circuit, which disrupts fuel pressure management and can cause hard starting or lean conditions.

P0002.title: Fuel Volume Regulator Control Circuit Range/Performance
P0002.description: The fuel volume regulator is not performing within expected parameters, affecting pressure control and overall fuel delivery.

P0003.title: Fuel Volume Regulator Control Circuit Low
P0003.description: The control circuit voltage for the fuel volume regulator is lower than expected, usually due to shorts or excessive resistance.

P0004.title: Fuel Volume Regulator Control Circuit High
P0004.description: The control circuit for the fuel volume regulator has higher than expected voltage, often caused by a short to power.

P0010.title: A Camshaft Position Actuator Circuit/Open (Bank 1)
P0010.description: The intake camshaft actuator solenoid circuit is open, causing improper valve timing control.

P0011.title: A Camshaft Timing Over-Advanced (Bank 1)
P0011.description: The intake camshaft is in a more advanced position than the PCM commands, usually due to oil flow or VVT issues.

P0012.title: A Camshaft Timing Over-Retarded (Bank 1)
P0012.description: The intake camshaft timing is excessively retarded compared to the commanded position.

P0013.title: B Camshaft Position Actuator Circuit/Open (Bank 1)
P0013.description: The exhaust cam actuator solenoid circuit for bank 1 has an open or invalid electrical condition.

P0014.title: B Camshaft Position Timing Over-Advanced (Bank 1)
P0014.description: The exhaust camshaft is over-advanced, typically due to a sticking actuator or oil management issue.

P0016.title: Crankshaft/Camshaft Position Correlation (Bank 1 Sensor A)
P0016.description: The crankshaft and camshaft positions do not correlate correctly, indicating mechanical timing issues.

P0017.title: Crankshaft/Camshaft Position Correlation (Bank 1 Sensor B)
P0017.description: The exhaust camshaft and crankshaft alignment is outside the allowable range.

P0020.title: A Camshaft Position Actuator Circuit (Bank 2)
P0020.description: The intake camshaft actuator on bank 2 has an electrical circuit failure.

P0021.title: A Camshaft Timing Over-Advanced (Bank 2)
P0021.description: The intake camshaft on bank 2 is more advanced than commanded, usually due to VVT or oil flow issues.

P0022.title: A Camshaft Timing Over-Retarded (Bank 2)
P0022.description: The intake camshaft timing on bank 2 is excessively retarded relative to PCM command, usually caused by oil flow problems or VVT actuator sticking.

P0023.title: B Camshaft Position Actuator Circuit (Bank 2)
P0023.description: The exhaust camshaft actuator circuit for bank 2 has an electrical fault causing incorrect valve timing control.

P0024.title: B Camshaft Timing Over-Advanced (Bank 2)
P0024.description: The exhaust camshaft on bank 2 is more advanced than the PCM commands, often due to sludge or actuator sticking.

P0030.title: HO2S Heater Control Circuit (Bank 1 Sensor 1)
P0030.description: The heater circuit in the upstream oxygen sensor is not drawing proper current, delaying closed-loop operation.

P0031.title: HO2S Heater Circuit Low (Bank 1 Sensor 1)
P0031.description: The upstream O2 sensor heater current is lower than expected due to open circuits or heater failure.

P0032.title: HO2S Heater Circuit High (Bank 1 Sensor 1)
P0032.description: Excessive current in the heater circuit of the upstream O2 sensor, usually from a short to power.

P0037.title: HO2S Heater Circuit Low (Bank 1 Sensor 2)
P0037.description: Downstream oxygen sensor heater current is lower than expected.

P0038.title: HO2S Heater Circuit High (Bank 1 Sensor 2)
P0038.description: The rear oxygen sensor heater is drawing too much current.

P0100.title: MAF Sensor Circuit Malfunction
P0100.description: A general electrical fault in the mass airflow sensor circuit resulting in incorrect airflow readings.

P0101.title: MAF Sensor Range/Performance
P0101.description: The MAF reading is outside the expected range for operating conditions.

P0102.title: MAF Sensor Low Input
P0102.description: The MAF sensor signal voltage is too low, indicating restricted airflow or sensor/wiring fault.

P0103.title: MAF Sensor High Input
P0103.description: The MAF output voltage is higher than expected, often due to an electrical short or unmetered air.

P0104.title: MAF Sensor Intermittent
P0104.description: The PCM detects an intermittent or unstable airflow reading.

P0110.title: Intake Air Temperature Sensor Circuit Malfunction
P0110.description: The IAT sensor is providing invalid temperature readings due to sensor or wiring faults.

P0112.title: IAT Sensor Low Input
P0112.description: The IAT sensor voltage is low, indicating an extremely hot air temperature signal.

P0113.title: IAT Sensor High Input
P0113.description: The IAT sensor voltage is high, showing an extremely cold temperature reading.

P0115.title: ECT Sensor Circuit Malfunction
P0115.description: The engine coolant temperature sensor circuit has a general fault affecting temperature readings.

P0117.title: ECT Sensor Low Input
P0117.description: The ECT sensor voltage is lower than expected, indicating an abnormally hot signal.

P0118.title: ECT Sensor High Input
P0118.description: The ECT sensor voltage is high, indicating an abnormally cold temperature signal.

P0128.title: Coolant Thermostat Below Regulating Temperature
P0128.description: The engine is not warming up to the expected temperature quickly enough.

P0130.title: O2 Sensor Circuit Malfunction (Bank 1 Sensor 1)
P0130.description: The upstream O2 sensor is not providing valid feedback to the PCM.

P0131.title: O2 Sensor Low Voltage (Bank 1 Sensor 1)
P0131.description: A persistently lean signal from the upstream O2 sensor.

P0132.title: O2 Sensor High Voltage (Bank 1 Sensor 1)
P0132.description: A rich signal from the upstream sensor beyond normal values.

P0133.title: O2 Sensor Slow Response (Bank 1 Sensor 1)
P0133.description: The O2 sensor is switching slower than expected due to aging or contamination.

P0134.title: O2 Sensor No Activity Detected (Bank 1 Sensor 1)
P0134.description: The upstream O2 sensor shows no measurable activity.

P0135.title: O2 Sensor Heater Circuit Malfunction (Bank 1 Sensor 1)
P0135.description: The heater element of the upstream O2 sensor is not functioning correctly.

P0140.title: O2 Sensor No Activity (Bank 1 Sensor 2)
P0140.description: The downstream oxygen sensor shows no switching activity.

P0141.title: O2 Sensor Heater Circuit Malfunction (Bank 1 Sensor 2)
P0141.description: The heater in the rear O2 sensor is not operating correctly.

P0150.title: O2 Sensor Circuit Malfunction (Bank 2 Sensor 1)
P0150.description: The Bank 2 upstream oxygen sensor circuit is malfunctioning.

P0155.title: O2 Sensor Heater Circuit Malfunction (Bank 2 Sensor 1)
P0155.description: The heater circuit for the Bank 2 upstream O2 sensor is faulty.

P0161.title: O2 Sensor Heater Circuit Malfunction (Bank 2 Sensor 2)
P0161.description: The downstream O2 sensor heater on Bank 2 has insufficient or excessive current.

P0170.title: Fuel Trim Malfunction (Bank 1)
P0170.description: Fuel trim adjustments have reached their limits on Bank 1.

P0171.title: System Too Lean (Bank 1)
P0171.description: The Bank 1 mixture is too lean, generally from unmetered air or low fuel.

P0172.title: System Too Rich (Bank 1)
P0172.description: Bank 1 has an overly rich air-fuel mixture.

P0174.title: System Too Lean (Bank 2)
P0174.description: Bank 2 is running lean due to air leaks or insufficient fuel.

P0175.title: System Too Rich (Bank 2)
P0175.description: The Bank 2 mixture is excessively rich.

P0180.title: Fuel Temperature Sensor A Circuit
P0180.description: The fuel temperature sensor signal is abnormal or out of range.

P0183.title: Fuel Temperature Sensor A Circuit High
P0183.description: The fuel temperature sensor voltage is too high, indicating a cold reading.

P0185.title: Fuel Temperature Sensor B Circuit
P0185.description: The secondary fuel temperature sensor is providing invalid readings.

P0188.title: Fuel Temperature Sensor B Circuit High
P0188.description: The secondary fuel temperature sensor voltage is too high.

P0190.title: Fuel Rail Pressure Sensor Circuit
P0190.description: The fuel rail pressure sensor signal is invalid or outside expected range.

P0191.title: Fuel Rail Pressure Range/Performance
P0191.description: The fuel pressure reading does not match commanded pressure under load.

P0193.title: Fuel Rail Pressure Sensor High Input
P0193.description: The fuel rail pressure sensor signal is higher than expected.

P0195.title: Engine Oil Temperature Sensor Malfunction
P0195.description: The PCM detects an invalid or missing signal from the engine oil temperature sensor.

P0196.title: Engine Oil Temperature Sensor Range
P0196.description: The PCM detects an invalid range for the engine oil temperature sensor.

P0197.title: Engine Oil Temperature Sensor Low Input
P0197.description: The engine oil temperature sensor voltage is low, indicating an abnormally hot oil temperature.

P0198.title: Engine Oil Temperature Sensor High Input
P0198.description: The EOT sensor voltage is high, indicating a cold sensor reading.

P0199.title: Engine Oil Temperature Sensor Intermittent
P0199.description: The PCM detects intermittent EOT sensor readings caused by wiring or sensor failure.

P0200.title: Injector Circuit Malfunction
P0200.description: The PCM detects an electrical fault in one or more fuel injector circuits.

P0201.title: Injector Circuit/Open – Cylinder 1
P0201.description: The fuel injector for cylinder 1 has an open or faulty circuit.

P0202.title: Injector Circuit/Open – Cylinder 2
P0202.description: The fuel injector for cylinder 2 is not operating due to a circuit fault.

P0203.title: Injector Circuit/Open – Cylinder 3
P0203.description: Cylinder 3 injector electrical circuit is open or failing.

P0204.title: Injector Circuit/Open – Cylinder 4
P0204.description: The injector for cylinder 4 is not receiving proper electrical control.

P0205.title: Injector Circuit/Open – Cylinder 5
P0205.description: The injector for cylinder 5 is not receiving proper electrical control due to an open or faulty circuit.

P0206.title: Injector Circuit/Open – Cylinder 6
P0206.description: The injector circuit for cylinder 6 is open or otherwise unable to deliver proper electrical control.

P0207.title: Injector Circuit/Open – Cylinder 7
P0207.description: Cylinder 7 injector control circuit has an open or malfunctioning electrical path.

P0208.title: Injector Circuit/Open – Cylinder 8
P0208.description: The injector for cylinder 8 has an open or faulty electrical circuit preventing proper fuel delivery.

P0209.title: Injector Circuit/Open – Cylinder 9
P0209.description: The injector circuit for cylinder 9 is open or otherwise failing to deliver electrical control.

P0210.title: Injector Circuit/Open – Cylinder 10
P0210.description: The PCM detects an electrical fault or open circuit in the injector for cylinder 10.

P0211.title: Injector Circuit/Open – Cylinder 11
P0211.description: The injector for cylinder 11 is not receiving proper electrical control due to a circuit failure.

P0212.title: Injector Circuit/Open – Cylinder 12
P0212.description: Cylinder 12 injector circuit is open or malfunctioning, preventing proper electrical operation.

P0213.title: Cold Start Injector 1 Circuit Malfunction
P0213.description: The cold-start injector 1 has an electrical fault preventing proper operation during cold start conditions.

P0214.title: Cold Start Injector 2 Circuit Malfunction
P0214.description: The PCM detects an electrical failure in the cold-start injector 2 circuit.

P0215.title: Engine Shutoff Solenoid Malfunction
P0215.description: The engine shutoff solenoid circuit has an electrical or mechanical failure affecting shutdown operation.

P0216.title: Injection Timing Control Circuit Malfunction
P0216.description: The PCM detects an electrical fault in the injection timing control circuit that affects fuel delivery timing.

P0217.title: Engine Overtemperature Condition
P0217.description: The PCM detects that the engine coolant temperature has exceeded safe limits.

P0221.title: Throttle/Pedal Position Sensor Range/Performance
P0221.description: The throttle or pedal position sensor signal is outside the normal operating range.

P0300.title: Random/Multiple Cylinder Misfire
P0300.description: Multiple cylinders are misfiring without a consistent pattern, often due to ignition, fuel, or vacuum issues.

P0301.title: Cylinder 1 Misfire
P0301.description: Cylinder 1 is misfiring due to ignition, fuel delivery, or compression issues.

P0302.title: Cylinder 2 Misfire
P0302.description: Cylinder 2 misfire caused by ignition, fuel, or compression problems.

P0303.title: Cylinder 3 Misfire
P0303.description: Cylinder 3 is not firing correctly based on PCM monitoring.

P0304.title: Cylinder 4 Misfire
P0304.description: Cylinder 4 misfire, often from ignition or fuel issues.

P0325.title: Knock Sensor Circuit Malfunction
P0325.description: The knock sensor is not producing the expected signal, affecting ignition timing control.

P0335.title: Crankshaft Position Sensor Circuit
P0335.description: The crankshaft position sensor is failing to provide a valid rotational signal.

P0340.title: Camshaft Position Sensor Circuit
P0340.description: The PCM cannot detect a proper signal from the camshaft position sensor.

P0400.title: EGR Flow Malfunction
P0400.description: Exhaust gas recirculation flow is incorrect or insufficient.

P0401.title: Insufficient EGR Flow
P0401.description: The PCM detects low EGR flow rate during operation.

P0402.title: Excessive EGR Flow
P0402.description: Too much EGR flow is entering the intake, causing rough idle or stalling.

P0410.title: Secondary Air Injection System Malfunction
P0410.description: The secondary air injection system is not supplying air to the exhaust during cold starts.

P0411.title: Secondary Air Injection Incorrect Flow
P0411.description: Airflow from the secondary air system does not match PCM expectations.

P0420.title: Catalyst System Efficiency Below Threshold (Bank 1)
P0420.description: The catalytic converter on bank 1 is not performing efficiently.

P0430.title: Catalyst System Efficiency Below Threshold (Bank 2)
P0430.description: Bank 2 catalytic converter efficiency has fallen below acceptable levels.

P0440.title: EVAP System Malfunction
P0440.description: A general fault has been detected in the evaporative emissions control system.

P0441.title: EVAP Incorrect Purge Flow
P0441.description: The purge valve is not flowing correctly when commanded.

P0442.title: EVAP System Small Leak Detected
P0442.description: A small vapor leak has been detected in the EVAP system.

P0446.title: EVAP Vent Control Circuit
P0446.description: The EVAP vent valve is not functioning correctly electrically.

P0455.title: EVAP System Large Leak Detected
P0455.description: A major leak has been detected in the evaporative emissions system.

P0456.title: EVAP System Very Small Leak Detected
P0456.description: A very small EVAP leak is present, often due to a worn gas cap or microcrack in a hose.

P0496.title: EVAP Flow During Non-Purge
P0496.description: The PCM detects that purge flow is occurring when it should not.
